titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Morris E. Leeds (1869-1952) was the son of Barclay R. Leeds (1834-1918) and Mary Maule Leeds. He graduated from Haverford College in 1888. His brother Arthur Newlin Leeds (1870-1939) also attended Haverford and was a noted naturalist. Their uncle, Lewis W. Leeds (ca. 1827-1896), was a Quaker businessman who promoted the use of a patent envelope in the years prior to the Civil War.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers and photographs of the Leeds family. Materials include: family correspondence; household account books; menu books; a diary of Barclay Leeds (1852-1854); genealogical notes and biographical sketches of members of the Leeds family; photos from various trips (1890s-1920s) and portraits of family members; a small amount of professional correspondence of Barclay Leeds, Arthur Leeds, and Morris Evans Leeds; personal memorabilia, such as the wedding certificate of Barclay and Mary Leeds and an album of nature illustrations by Arthur Leeds. The collection also includes genealogical information on the Leeds family, and an almanac, dated 1696, belonging to Daniel Leeds.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Friends Historical Library, Swarthmore College: Hadassah M.L. Holcombe diaries; Hagley Museum and Library: Leeds & Northrup Company records.
